title: Frequently Asked Questions
subtitle: Here are some questions I usually get. Click to toggle the answer!

faqs.question: What areas of law do you handle?
faqs.answer: We handle a range of everyday legal matters for individuals and families, including family law, real estate, wills and estates, Landlord and Tenant Board matters, and small claims. We also assist with select immigration services.If your issue falls outside our scope, we’ll tell you early and help point you in the right direction when possible.

faqs.question: Do you provide services in English and Chinese?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our team can assist in English and Chinese (including Cantonese and Mandarin, depending on the staff involved). If language is important for your file, let us know when you contact us so we can match you with the right team member and keep communication clear from day one.

faqs.question: How quickly can I get started, and can you help with urgent deadlines?
faqs.answer: If you have a deadline (a court date, hearing, closing date, or notice with a response deadline), contact us as soon as possible and tell us the date upfront. We’ll review timing and capacity quickly and let you know what’s realistic.Even if we can’t take it on, we’ll still aim to help you understand your next best step so you’re not stuck.

faqs.question: How much does it cost to hire your firm?
faqs.answer:
Fees depend on the type of matter and how complex it is. In general:
  • Some services are often suitable for flat fees (commonly in real estate, and certain wills and family law contracts)
  • Other matters are typically hourly (commonly in family law disputes and litigation)

Before you commit, we’ll explain the billing structure clearly, what work is likely required, and how you can control costs.

faqs.question: What is a retainer, and how does billing work?
faqs.answer:
A retainer is a deposit paid in advance and held in trust. As we work on your file, fees and any applicable expenses are billed against that retainer. We’ll tell you:
  • what the retainer is intended to cover,
  • how billing is calculated, and
  • when you might need to replenish it (if required).
No surprises. If something changes, we communicate early.

faqs.question: Who will work on my file, and how will I receive updates?
faqs.answer: You’ll have a clear point of contact and a team supporting the file. We prioritize responsiveness and clarity —you shouldn’t have to wonder what’s happening.We’ll explain the next steps, what we need from you, and when you can expect updates. If you email or call with a reasonable question, you can expect a timely response, even if the answer is “we’re working on it and here’s where things stand.”
